meanings.definition: Talk rapidly and excitedly, often in a foolish or nonsensical way.
meanings.sent1: She jabbers on the phone with her friend for hours.
meanings.sent2: The parrot jabbers loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The toddler jabbers to his stuffed animals, creating his own little world.
meanings.sent4: The stream jabbers as it flows over the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The excited puppy jabbers happily as it plays with its toy.

meanings.definition: A person who talks rapidly and excitedly, often in a foolish or nonsensical way.
meanings.sent1: The jabbers at the party kept everyone entertained with their stories.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was never quiet with the jabbers around.
meanings.sent3: The jabbers in the office always have a new joke to share.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the jabbers of the neighborhood due to her chatty nature.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends laughed at the antics of the jabbers among them.
